Name of Agency to Which this Form Applie: Department of the Army  US Army Central
Additional Scope Comments: Army Corps of Engineers, RG 77, Office of the Surgeon General RG 112, Army Staff RG 319,  Army Secretariat RG 335, Army Special Operations Command  RG 338, Army Space & Missile Defense Command RG 338,  Army Surface Deployment & Distribution Command RG 338, US Army South RG 338, US Army North/5th Army RG 338, US Army Africa RG 338, Army Materiel Command RG 544, US Army Europe RG 549, US Army Pacific RG 550, Army Training & Doctrine Command RG 553, Army Forces Command RG 555.Other emails will be managed using standard Records Management practices based on content of the email.  They will be placed into electronic folders in the Army Records Information Management System (ARIMS).  Army is also pursuing other automated records management solutions with DOD and other DOD Components for use in automated processing of all electronic records.
Legacy Email Scope: Agency will be including legacy email dating back to 2013, as the email journaling policy defined in the Army Regulation 25-400-2 Army Records Information Management System was in place prior to Capstone.
Whom should NARA contact if there any qu: Anthony D. Crawley-Gibson,  Chief, Army Records Management Division, Anthony.d.crawley-gibson.civ@mail.mil ,  703-428-6464

Additional Scope Comments: Item 010 - cut off at the end of tenure.Item 011 - will be applied to all positions not listed below as Capstone Accounts.Since the NSA/CSS Director is also the Commander, U.S. Cyber Command, the scope includes email records created/received by the Commander, U.S. Cyber Command. The Records Group for U.S. Cyber Command is 218.The majority of positions have three accounts (high, medium, low).
Legacy Email Scope: A traditional records management approach with a print-to-file policy was enforced prior to Capstone adoption, as well as use of other disposition authorities to capture email. Some legacy email, however, exists; the scope of legacy email varies by position with the earliest date being 1999.
URL to Agency Organization Chart: Review of agency organization chart conducted by NARA Records Appraisal and Agency Assistance staff during appraisal visit on 17 November 2015.

Additional Scope Comments: (A) Treasury components - separate Forms NA-1005: The following Treasury components (including bureaus and offices of Inspectors General) will submit separate Forms NA-1005 in anticipation of adopting the Capstone General Records Schedule (GRS 6.1) -- -- Alcohol and Tobacco Tax and Trade Bureau (Record Group 564) -- Bureau of Engraving and Printing (RG 318) -- Bureau of the Fiscal Service (RG 425) -- Community Development Financial Institutions Fund (RG 056)  -- Financial Crimes Enforcement Network (RG 559) -- Treasury Inspector General for Tax Administration (RG 056) -- Office of the Inspector General (RG 056) -- United States Mint (RG 104)(B) Other Treasury components: Please note the following -   -- Internal Revenue Service (RG 058) obtained a non-GRS records schedule (Standard Form 115) for email in October 2015 -- Office of the Comptroller of the Currency (RG 101) will obtain a non-GRS records schedule (SF 115) for email -- Office of the Special Inspector General for the Troubled Asset Relief Program (RG 056) is incorporated in this Form NA-1005(C) Other Departmental Offices: The Office of Foreign Assets Control within Departmental Offices will submit a separate Form NA-1005 under its separate records group (RG 265).(D) Administrative records for non-Capstone accounts: These records will be retained for seven years.
Cutoff Instructions: Email of Capstone officials (item 010) will be cut off at the end of the employee’s tenure.
Transfer Instructions: Email of Capstone officials (item 010) will be transferred to NARA either 15 years after cutoff or after declassification review (when applicable), whichever is later.
Legacy Email Scope: Departmental Offices will be including legacy email for all items being used, dating back to 2001.  Agency is still determining the full scope of our legacy email.  It dates back to sometime before 2001.  We will report our full finding to NARA within 6 months.
